snippet: Stanton, 25, may become the first player with a $300 million deal, as the Marlins are discussing an extension that could stretch for 13 years.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column contends that free agent Giancarlo Stanton is perfect candidate to have richest contract in baseball history, with spotless image and ferocious power in an era of declining offense; Stanton and Miami Marlins are in negotiations for a contract that could stretch for 13 years at $25 million per season.
lead_paragraph: Stanton, 25, may become the first player with a $300 million deal, as the Marlins are discussing an extension that could stretch for 13 years.

headline.main: Giancarlo Stanton Is a Power Hitter Negotiating a Power Contract
headline.print_headline: A Power Hitter Negotiating a Power Contract
